node.title: Biden Administration Resuming Trump's 'Remain in Mexico' Policy Starting Next Week
node.alt: The Biden administration and Mexico have agreed to a reinstatement of a Trump-era border policy next week. Above, migrants arrive in Villa Comaltitlan on October 27 as they journey through Mexico to the U.S. border.
node.description: The revived policy comes after intense negotiations between the U.S. and Mexico.
node.content:
["The Biden administration will reinstate a Trump-era border policy with the help of the Mexican government, the Associated Press reports.", "The \"Remain in Mexico\" policy will take effect next week after being suspended by President Joe Biden on his first day in office. Around 70,000 asylum seekers coming from Mexico have been subjected to the policy, which was introduced in 2019.", "Migrants in detention will be returned to Mexico starting Monday. All migrants subject to the policy will be vaccinated against COVID-19 before being deported. The U.S. is expected to complete migrant cases within 180 days, with 22 immigration judges assigned to work solely on them by the Justice Department, the AP said.", "This is a developing story and will be updated when new information becomes available.", "", "
The Biden administration and Mexico have agreed to a reinstatement of a Trump-era border policy next week. Above, migrants arrive in Villa Comaltitlan on October 27 as they journey through Mexico to the U.S. border.
"]
